title: Blue Archive

new.description:
Blue Archive is a role-playing game developed by Nexon Games, a subsidiary of Nexon. It was released in 2021 for Android and iOS, first in Japan by Yostar and worldwide later that year by Nexon. The game is free-to-play with gacha game mechanics as a means to obtain new characters.

The player and protagonist is a teacher who was summoned to the academy city of Kivotos by the president of the General Student Council, an extrajudicial committee governing the schools. Following her sudden disappearance, criminal activity rises around Kivotos, and the player is tasked by the remaining members of the council to resolve the issues and help search for the president.

(Source: Wikipedia)

The "Section chief" of Problem Solver 68 and a 3rd-year student at Gehenna Academy.

Unlike the other fixers, She is not one with ill intentions. However, she is often misunderstood as a delinquent simply due to naturally scary facial expressions and appearance. She normally prefers to keep silent about this topic, as it likely leads to furthering her terrifying image.

Takanashi Hoshino is the former vice president and the only third-year of Abydos High School, and the current chairwoman for the Countermeasures Committee.

Speaking like a senile aunt, she enjoys playing around and napping more than work. Because of this, she usually gets scolded by the rest of the Committee. But, once the mission starts, she protects her comrades by fighting valiantly on the front lines.

A member of the Pandemonium Society who often views everything as a pain. Not surprising, considering her boss is always stirring up trouble. As she carries out her duties day by day, she lets out a sigh or two and performs her tasks with indifference.

The treasurer of the Millennium Academy Student Council. She is strict about money and often quarrels with other club activities from her standpoint.

Generally polite, professional, and easy to deal with if you treat her well. However, most of the people she interacts with are very difficult to deal with, which leads to angry outbursts. This earns her a reputation as cold and ruthless, even though she really isn't. She takes pride in her mathematical skills to the point of stubbornly refusing to believe in the randomness of gacha games. She will also try to cover up her own mistakes due to her pride, such as when she pretended to spend less than 10,000 yen on chocolate.

The sports-loving field captain of the Countermeasures Committee of the Abydos High School.

A soft-spoken girl, who deeply cares for her friends, to the extent that she would do anything to help her friends towards their goal of revitalizing the school. Though she is generally calm and reserved, she hyper-focuses on certain interests and can sometimes be oblivious to how others would react to them. She often bikes and walks far more than regular people can keep up, thinking distances of 10s of kilometers are average for her. She fantasizes about robbing banks.
A mysterious student(?) whose appearance is unmistakably Sunaookami Shiroko's, but is not quite the same.

The leader of the Arius Squad.

An unparalleled expert in guerilla tactics, Saori can stay calm under pressure and doesn't hesitate to use whatever means necessary to accomplish her objective.

Saori shows the personalities a leader would normally have: fierce, strategic, and responsible. Saori may often come off as stoic, overly serious, and unsociable, but once she shows her emotions, she does not hold back.

Koharu is a member of the Supplemental Lessons Club of Trinity Integrated Academy. Originally a member of the Justice Actualization Committee, she was forcefully transferred to the Supplemental Lessons Club due to her falling grades and being made to repeat a year.

While she may consider herself elite, she is actually rather stupid, so much so in fact that she is completely unable to keep up with her lessons. She has a secret hobby of collecting lewd magazines and experiences delusions about the most trivial things in everyday life.

Student of Trinity Integrated Academy and the former leader of "Patel", the student union that makes up Trinity.

Mika is a former member of the Tea Party and is also a childhood friend of its leader, Nagisa. However, because of their opposing political positions, they make a clear distinction between their public and private lives. Mika always presents a happy smile and innocent appearance, but she seems to be troubled by something she's unable to confide in others.

Enrolled at Trinity Integrated Academy, Hasumi is the Justice Actualization Committee's No. 2.

In place of its president, Tsurugi, who embodies wildness, Hasumi also acts as the Justice Actualization Committee's tactical commander.

At a glance she appears composed and intellectual, like the archetypal Trinity student. However, Hasumi too is a fully-fledged member of the Justice Actualization Committee, and will sometimes act recklessly while retaining her composed nature.

Enrolled at Gehenna Academy, Haruna is the club president of the Gourmet Research Society.

Upon first look at her, one might think she is a rich princess-like and aloof elegance, but get her involved in talks of food and all sense of distinction is lost in this zealous gourmet.
In contrast to such gluttony, she is actually not one with much of an appetite. Favorite foods are greasy, full of hormones, and stew-centric.

Gehenna Academy's self-appointed president of Problem Solver 68, conducts all sorts of illegal business as she pleases.

While Aru considers herself to be a cool outlaw, but she often falls out of character and thus any appearance disparities are easily revealed.

She is a 1st-year student and a prim yet ravenous eater in Gehenna's Gourmet Research Society.

Differing from the other members who often overeat everyday food, Junko is one to take part in a certain extent of enjoying reasonable quality gastronomy but is sometimes known to lose her sense of reason when delicious foods are placed in front of her. Her favorite food is dango.

She is a 3rd-year student and the current chairwoman of Gehenna's Prefect Team, who is rightfully feared by every student in the academy if not all of Kivotos.

A troublesome, laid-back person, who calls it a "hassle" when she talks about school rules. She wishes to retire as she feels exhausted by everything involving Gehenna.

A 2nd-year student at Gehenna Academy, Mutsuki holds the title of "Chief of staff" and is the assault activist and go-getter of Problem Solver 68.

Mutsuki is a mischievous prankster at heart, she often exposes Aru's true colors for fun. Contrary to her guilt-riddled childhood friend Aru, she is a devilish troublemaker and commits acts of wanton wrongdoing without hesitation.

She does not belong to any club and is independent. However, as one of the seven students who escaped the Federal Correction Bureau, she is a member of the Seven Prisoners. 

Known as the Fox of Misfortune for her indiscriminate and large-scale destruction, she is widely feared. Her motives and purpose are shrouded in mystery. Her true face, hidden beneath the mask, is rumored to be as scary as a demon or as ugly as the devil.

Originally named "AL-1S", Alice is a mysterious Millennium's Game Development Dept member. Found in an abandoned munitions factory at the Ruins, it's impossible to retrieve any information about her origin or age.

At first, her personality was robotic in both speaking and answering. As the story progresses, she acts more lively although her speech and mannerisms are nearly close to someone with the "Chuunibyou" syndrome, a result of being exposed to playing video games.

Instructor of the Training Support Department "Plum Blossom Garden" of Shanhaijing Senior Secondary School.

Shun is considered as gentle and composed when it comes to handling the children of "Plum Blossom Garden." Like many people, she has a limit and she will start acting childlike once she passed her limit. She also worries about herself and often complains about how she's getting too old. For some reason, she doesn't want anyone to know her age.

A 2nd-year student and a cold-blooded specialist of the feared Prefect Team. As the field captain of its assault corps, she immediately punishes students who violate the rules with overwhelming force whenever and wherever she finds them.

She's strict with the rules, Iori will punish any and all rule-breakers. Although she's skilled in combat, she tends to be blind to her surroundings when engaging a target. She is also quite exhausted due to having to deal with troublemakers despite the holidays.

Hinata is a student of Sisterhood who is in charge of "managing the supplies in the cathedral". She is serious and dedicated to her work, but she is also a bit of a dilettante and often makes mistakes that cause her to lose confidence...

A hard-working Sister of the Sisterhood. Hinata possesses physical strength incomparable to the other Sisters, allowing her to easily do heavy-lifting tasks that would require the strength of two or more Sisters. She is also quite clumsy, often forgetting to do simple yet important things such as keeping the door locked.

The problem child of the Supplementary Lesson Department. Despite her appearance, she's a student who only says naughty things when she talks, and her members always seem to be nervous...

She has a huge risqué behavior, doing things like attending classes in her swimsuit and having almost every word escape her mouth be a double entendre, which makes everyone uneasy around her. However, it's revealed she's very intelligent, and only acts bawdy to prevent the Sisterhood or Tea Party from trying to recruit her, as Hanako doesn't want to play their political games.
Ako, an administrative officer of the Disciplinary Committee, belonging to Gehenna Academy!

author: Fable Community
description: A pack containing the various characters from the game Blue Archive
